intro: Diplotaxis duveyrieriana, commonly known as the Cape dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces slender, hairy stems and has a compact growth habit, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a drought-tolerant ornamental plant. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its resilience to coastal conditions.
